paws 0.1.10

Amazon DynamoDB Streams

Source: R/dynamodbstreams_service.R
dynamodbstreams.Rd

Amazon DynamoDB

Amazon DynamoDB Streams provides API actions for accessing streams and processing stream records. To learn more about application development with Streams, see Capturing Table Activity with DynamoDB Streams in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

dynamodbstreams(config = list())

Arguments

config

Optional configuration of credentials, endpoint, and/or region.

Service syntax

svc <- dynamodbstreams(
  config = list(
    credentials = list(
      creds = list(
        access_key_id = "string",
        secret_access_key = "string",
        session_token = "string"
      ),
      profile = "string"
    ),
    endpoint = "string",
    region = "string"
  )
)

Operations

describe_streamReturns information about a stream, including the current status of the stream, its Amazon Resource Name (ARN), the composition of its shards, and its corresponding DynamoDB table
get_recordsRetrieves the stream records from a given shard
get_shard_iteratorReturns a shard iterator
list_streamsReturns an array of stream ARNs associated with the current account and endpoint

Examples

if (FALSE) {
svc <- dynamodbstreams()
# The following example describes a stream with a given stream ARN.
svc$describe_stream(
  StreamArn = "arn:aws:dynamodb:us-west-2:111122223333:table/Forum/stream/2015-05-20T20:51:1..."
)
}
